What comes after death is one of the most fundamental questions of philosophy that humanity has considered; be it a Valhalla or Heaven or reincarnation or a higher plane of reality. The question is, of course, does a person (i.e. me) exists after death? It depends on your definition of existence. To be aliveTo be foundTo have objective reality or beingAfter you pass, your body still exists; the atoms and chemical bonds that make you up will may eventually be swallowed by the earth, but they still exist. After you pass, your impact on the Earth will echo throughout the ages. Your interactions with others influenced the world. After you pass, you are no longer defined as ‘alive’ in this reality, by our petty human rules. Who knows what comes beyond? Does your consciousness continue? Scientist say that your mind enters a hyperactive state after death, but it is unknown what happens to your consciousness post-mortem. This question is one that cannot be answered by another, you must find the answer yourself. How you define your world defines the word existence for you. In conclusion, do I exist after dying? I’d like to think so, but I’m not basing my life on it. There are no guarantees in this world.
